ItemType.name: Abbasid thanogram
ItemType.description: This is a neural network initialized from the cerebral patterns of one or more Scholars of Abbasid. The legal, ethical, and moral knowledge of the Abbasid is contained and interpreted by these constructs.

Language.Text:
You hear a voice talking in a foreign language, yet somehow you understand it. They are narrating the story of their life, and though you listen for only a moment, you remember hearing the whole thing.
You feel that Domina is pleased.

ItemType.name: portable analyzer
ItemType.description: Analyzers are automated scanners able to identify and diagnose starship devices and other items. This portable analyzer works on items of level 1, 2 and 3.

ItemType.name: engineering analyzer
ItemType.description: An engineering analyzer is a more complex and capable version of the portable analyzer. This analyzer works on items up to level 6.

ItemType.name: advanced analyzer
ItemType.description: The advanced analyzer is often used for researching unknown and alien technology. This analyzer works on items up to level 10.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]ablative armor coating
ItemType.description: This coating is used to protect a ship's armor against laser weapons.

Language.Text: The paste is an ablative coating that resists laser damage.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]reactive armor coating
ItemType.description: This coating reacts when hit by kinetic weapons and produces an opposite reaction that protect the underlying armor and hull.

Language.Text: The paste is a reactive coating that resists kinetic damage.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]carbon-weaver nanos
ItemType.description: The nanomachines in this paste weave a strong carbon grid through a ship's armor. Armor that has been treated in this way will be stronger and more resistant to damage.

Language.Text: The coating is composed of nanomachines that strengthen your armor.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]organic acid
ItemType.description: Powerful organic acids such as these are used in various industrial processes. Use with caution: Do not allow contact with a ship's armor or hull.

Language.Text: Unfortunately, the barrel contained an organic acid that eats through most metals. The armor segment has been damaged.
Unfortunately, the barrel contained an organic acid that eats through most metals. The armor segment has been destroyed.
Using organic acid will damage the %dstItem%.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]decon gel
ItemType.description: Decon gel is used to decontaminate radioactive metals, ceramics and other materials. It is ideal for decontaminating a ship's armor and hull.

Language.Text: Using this barrel of gel will decontaminate your ship.
The barrel was filled with a decontamination gel. Your ship has been decontaminated.
Your ship is not radioactive, so the gel will not have any effect.
The barrel was filled with a decontamination gel. Since your ship is not radioactive, the gel had no effect.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]particle resistance coating
ItemType.description: This coating is used to protect a ship's armor against particle beam weapons.

Language.Text: The paste is a coating that resists particle damage.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]plasteel nanos
ItemType.description: The nanomachines in this paste create a hard plasteel shell on top of armor segments.

Language.Text: The coating is composed of plasteel nanomachines that strengthen your armor.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]reflective armor coating
ItemType.description: This coating is nearly perfectly reflective at all laser weapon wavelengths. A ship's armor coated with this substance will be immune to laser weapons.

Language.Text: The paste is a mirrored coating that reflects laser beams.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]anti-radiation coating
ItemType.description: This borocarbide coating absorbs deadly radiation before it can penetrate your ship's hull.

Language.Text: The barrel contains a borocarbide paste that resists radiation.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]degenerating nanos
ItemType.description: These nanomachines are used to recycle old ships and armors into their basic components. Use with caution: Do not allow contact with a ship's armor or hull.

Language.Text: The paste is a nanomachine matrix that dissolves metals and composites.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]radioactive waste
ItemType.description: This is a titanium barrel filled with low and medium-level radioactive waste.

Language.Text: Your ship is already contaminated, so opening this barrel will have no effect.
The barrel contained radioactive waste. Your ship is already radioactive; the waste has no further effect.
Opening the barrel of radioactive waste will contaminate your ship.
The barrel contained radioactive waste. Your ship has been contaminated.
Opening the barrel of radioactive waste will contaminate your ship.
The barrel contained radioactive waste which just emptied inside your cargo hold. Your ship has been contaminated.
This %dstItem% is immune to radiation. The barrel will have no effect.
The barrel contained radioactive waste. Fortunately, your armor is immune to radiation. The waste has no effect.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]regenerating nanos
ItemType.description: The nanomachines are able to automatically regenerate any armor. Once treated with this paste an armor segment will continue to regenerate even if damaged further.

Language.Text: The paste is a nanomachine matrix that regenerates the armor segment.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]monopole dust
ItemType.description: When applied to armor, monopole dust dissipates EMP energy, rendering it harmless.

Language.Text: The barrel contains monopole dust, which protects your armor against EMP effects.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]particle-reflect coating
ItemType.description: This coating reflects particle beams.

Language.Text: The paste is a coating that reflects particle beams.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]ion resistance coating
ItemType.description: This coating is used to protect a ship's armor against ion damage.

Language.Text: The paste is a coating that resists ion damage.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]meteorsteel dust
ItemType.description: Meteorsteel interferes with most kinds of shield generators.

Language.Text: The barrel contains meteorsteel dust.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]dyon dust
ItemType.description: Dust activated by dyons immunizes armor against ionization effects such as blinding, EMP, and device ionization.

Language.Text: The barrel contains dyon dust, which immunizes your armor against ionization effects.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]ion-reflect coating
ItemType.description: This coating reflects ion damage.

Language.Text: The paste is a coating that reflects ion damage.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]ithalium paste
ItemType.description: This coating is used to protect a ship's armor against thermonuclear damage.

Language.Text: The paste is a coating that resists thermonuclear damage.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]orthosteel nanos
ItemType.description: The nanomachines in this paste weave a strong orthosteel grid through a ship's armor. Armor that has been treated in this way will be stronger and more resistant to damage.

Language.Text: The coating is composed of nanomachines that strengthen your armor.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]armor repair paste
ItemType.description: Apply this paste to an armor segment to repair light to moderate damage. It works on armor up to level 5.

Language.Text: The paste is a silicon-based compound that patches damaged sections of your armor.

ItemType.name: small armor patch(es)
ItemType.description: This is a small armor plate that can be welded to your ship's armor to repair damage. It works on armor up to level 5.

ItemType.name: large armor patch(es)
ItemType.description: This is a large armor plate that can be welded to your ship's armor to repair damage. It works on armor up to level 7.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]repairing nanos
ItemType.description: Apply this paste to an armor segment to repair moderate to heavy damage. It works on armor up to level 7.

Language.Text: The paste contains a colony of nanomachines that can repair your armor.

ItemType.name: light armor repair kit
ItemType.description: This kit can be used in the field to repair damaged armor. It will repair up to 100 hp of damage. It work on armor up to level 9.

ItemType.name: medium armor repair kit
ItemType.description: This kit can be used in the field to repair damaged armor. It will repair up to 175 hp of damage.

ItemType.name: heavy armor repair kit
ItemType.description: This kit can be used in the field to repair damaged armor. It will repair up to 300 hp of damage.

ItemType.name: sealed container with black markings
ItemType.description: This is a sealed container generally used by the Sindikat to move illegal items around from system to system.

ItemType.name: black market identification chip
ItemType.description: This identification chip is used by pirates and other outlaws to identify each other in the black market. Only people who have this chip can trade in the black market.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]Centauri nanos
ItemType.description: These nanomachines weave a diamond matrix through the target material. Armor that has been treated in this way will be more resistant to laser and impact damage.

Language.Text: The coating is composed of nanomachines that strengthen your armor against laser and impact damage.

ItemType.name: Charon base map ROM
ItemType.description: This program contains the location of all Charon pirate bases in the system.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block (found) ; We map all Charon stations (enum (sysFindObject gSource "AT:charonPirates;") obj (block Nil (objSetKnown obj) (setq found True) ) )
(if found (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Mapped all Charon pirate stations in system") (objSendMessage gSource Nil "No Charon pirate stations in system") )
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1)
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem) )

ItemType.name: Ares Campaign Ribbon
ItemType.description: The Commonwealth Fleet awards this ribbon to all who have been in combat against the Ares Orthodoxy.

ItemType.name: unmarked data ROM
ItemType.attributes: cannotOrder, consumable, info, lamplighterDataROM, notForSale, questItem
ItemType.description: This unmarked ROM contains what looks like experimental data. It contains millions of data points collected over several years; their meaning and purpose is unknown.

ItemType.name: unknown prototype weapon
ItemType.description: This is weapon prototype of some kind. Its markings suggest that it was created by the Commonwealth Fleet.

ItemType.name: helium³ fuel rod
ItemType.description: This standard He³ fuel rod fits most starship reactors.

ItemType.name: ROM biosoft(s)
ItemType.description: These ROM biochips are generally used to upgrade a computer's neural network. Unfortunately, you have no knowledge of the software's specific nature or purpose.

ItemType.name: inert metal sphere
ItemType.description: This is a one-meter sphere of a dark metal, etched with a network of thin lines and complex shapes.

Events.GetGlobalAchievements: (block ( (theStatus (typGetData &itDallSphere; "status")) (achievementText (switch (objGetItems gPlayerShip "* +unid:&itDallSphere;") 'achievement.found (= theStatus 'found) 'achievement.lost (= theStatus 'withDall) 'achievement.withDall (= theStatus 'donated) 'achievement.donated (= theStatus 'destroyed) 'achievement.destroyed )) ) (if (and theStatus achievementText) (list (list (typTranslate &itDallSphere; achievementText) Nil (typTranslate &unidCommonText; 'achievementsAndRegrets) ) ) ) )
Events.OnObjDestroyed:
(switch ; If not our object, then nothing to do
(!= gSource aObjDestroyed) Nil
; If the ship we're on got destroyed, but it left a wreck with the ; sphere on it, then we're OK.
(and aWreckObj (objGetItems aWreckObj "* +unid:&itDallSphere;")) Nil
; If the ship got destroyed in a gravity well, then the sphere is ; permanently destroyed. (Otherwise we would keep creating and ; destroying the sphere.)
(= aDestroyReason 'gravity) (typSetData &itDallSphere; 'status 'destroyed)
; Otherwise, the object drops on its own
(block (theObj) (setq theObj (sysCreateStation &stDallSphere; (objGetPos gSource))) (objAddItem theObj (itmCreate &itDallSphere; 1)) (objIncVel theObj (sysVectorPolarVelocity (random 0 359) 5)) ) )
Events.OnUpdate:
(if (and (not (eq (sysGetNode) "SK")) (eq gSource gPlayerShip)) (block (roll) (setq roll (random 1 100)) (switch (leq roll 4) (block Nil (objMakeParalyzed gSource 150) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate &itDallSphere; 'msgPowerSurge)) )
(leq roll 10) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate &itDallSphere; 'msgPowerPulse)) ) ) )

Language.Text: A power surge from the sphere disables your ship
The sphere in your cargo hold pulses with power

A thunderclap knocks you down, and you hear an alien voice in your head. Images of destruction and death fly through your mind, leaving a dull pain behind.
When you open your eyes, the sphere is gone.
Destroyed Professor Dall's alien sphere
Donated Professor Dall's alien sphere to the Sisters of Domina
Found Professor Dall's alien sphere
Found and lost Professor Dall's alien sphere
Found and delivered Professor Dall's alien sphere

ItemType.name: gem(s) of despair
ItemType.attributes: alien, cannotOrder, communion, haloGem, minorItem, psionic
ItemType.description: These gems are used by the Halo Races, though their exact purpose is unknown. The dark-energies embedded in the gem have an influence over spacetime that is not yet fully understood.
ItemType.Invoke:
(if (find (sysGetNodes) "Elysium") (block Nil ; Gate to Elysium (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgResult)) (objGateTo gSource "Elysium" "Start" &efStargateOut;)
; Remove the item from the player's list (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1)
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem) )
; Elysium not found (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgNoEffect)) )

Language.String: "May you find your path among the stargates..."
Language.Text: The gem flickers for a moment but then fades without effect.

ItemType.name: gem(s) of contrition
ItemType.attributes: alien, cannotOrder, communion, haloGem, minorItem, psionic
ItemType.description: These gems are used by the Halo Races, though their exact purpose is unknown. The dark-energies embedded in the gem have an influence over spacetime that is not yet fully understood.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil ; Stop time (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgResult)) (sysStopTime 500 gSource)
; Remove the item from the player's list (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1)
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem) )

Language.String: "Use this time to right your wrongs..."

ItemType.name: gem(s) of fury
ItemType.attributes: alien, cannotOrder, communion, haloGem, minorItem, psionic
ItemType.description: These gems are used by the Halo Races, though their exact purpose is unknown. The dark-energies embedded in the gem have an influence over spacetime that is not yet fully understood.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objAddOverlay gSource &ovGemOfFury; 3000) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgResult))
; Remove the item from the player's list (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1)
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem) )

ItemType.name: gem(s) of sacrifice
ItemType.attributes: alien, cannotOrder, communion, haloGem, minorItem, psionic
ItemType.description: These gems are used by the Halo Races, though their exact purpose is unknown. The dark-energies embedded in the gem have an influence over spacetime that is not yet fully understood.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block (sacrificeEffect) ; Function to lower shields and armor (setq sacrificeEffect (lambda (theObj) (block Nil (objDepleteShields theObj)
(for i 0 (subtract (shpGetArmorCount theObj) 1) (if (leq (itmGetLevel (shpGetArmor theObj i)) 12) (block (theDamage) (setq theDamage (divide (multiply (shpGetArmorMaxHitPoints theObj i) (random 96 99)) 100)) (shpDamageArmor theObj i 12 theDamage) ) ) )
(objSetProperty theObj 'interiorHP (random 1 10))
(sysCreateEffect &efGemOfSacrifice; theObj (objGetPos theObj)) ) ))
; All ships in range have their shields lowered (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgResult)) (enum (sysFindObject gSource "sN:30;") theObj (sacrificeEffect theObj) )
; Invoker also gets effect (sacrificeEffect gSource)
; Remove the item from the player's list (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1)
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem) )

ItemType.name: Heliotrope fuel cylinder
ItemType.description: Heliotrope starship fuel is known to be one of the cleanest and most powerful fuels available. Too bad the Heliotrope don't part with it willingly.

ItemType.name: stargate control rod
ItemType.attributes: alien, hereticStargate, hyperglyphRod, minorItem, notForSale, questItem
ItemType.description: This hyperglyph rod is used to program stargates.

ItemType.name: Iocrym cybernetic tower
ItemType.description: This massive and beautiful crystalline tower is clearly part of a larger structure.

ItemType.name: Iocrym sentinel virus(es)
ItemType.description: This cube contains an infiltrator virus that will disable Iocrym sentinels within 50 light-seconds.
ItemType.Invoke:
(switch ; If we don't have a quantum CPU (not (progHasQuantumCPU gSource)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Quantum CPU required")
; Otherwise, we disable any Iocrym sentinels (block (targets) (setq targets (sysFindObject gSource "sN:50; +iocrymSentinel;")) (enum targets target (objMakeParalyzed target (random 9000 15000)) ) (if targets (objSendMessage gSource Nil "ISV0.9b: Program complete") (objSendMessage gSource Nil "ISV0.9b: No target signal") )
(itmSetKnown gItem) (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) ) )

ItemType.name: data ROM(s) labeled "Heretic research"
ItemType.description: This ROM contains research data about Iocrym technology.

ItemType.name: data ROM(s) labeled "Heretic research"
ItemType.attributes: hereticROM, info, lesserData, minorItem, notForSale, questItem
ItemType.description: This ROM contains research data about Iocrym technology.

ItemType.name: [ROM(s) of ]Rowena's Weapons and Armor: Volume I
ItemType.description: The definitive guide to starship weapons and armor. This ROM contains specification for commercially available weapons and armor of the Commonwealth.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objSendMessage gSource Nil "\"Rowena's Weapons and Armor (Volume I)\" installed") (itmEnumTypes "adsw" itemType (if (and (geq (itmGetLevel itemType) 1) (leq (itmGetLevel itemType) 5)) (itmSetReference itemType) ) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

ItemType.name: [ROM(s) of ]Rowena's Weapons and Armor: Volume II
ItemType.description: The definitive guide to starship weapons and armor. This ROM contains specification for military weapons and armor used in the Commonwealth.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objSendMessage gSource Nil "\"Rowena's Weapons and Armor (Volume II)\" installed") (itmEnumTypes "adsw" itemType (if (and (geq (itmGetLevel itemType) 6) (leq (itmGetLevel itemType) 10)) (itmSetReference itemType) ) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

ItemType.name: [ROM(s) of ]Rowena's Weapons and Armor: Volume III
ItemType.description: The definitive guide to starship weapons and armor. This ROM contains specification for weapons and armor used by the Ancient Races.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objSendMessage gSource Nil "\"Rowena's Weapons and Armor (Volume III)\" installed") (itmEnumTypes "adsw" itemType (if (and (geq (itmGetLevel itemType) 11) (leq (itmGetLevel itemType) 15)) (itmSetReference itemType) ) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

ItemType.name: [ROM(s) of ]Rowena's Weapons and Armor: Volume IV
ItemType.description: The definitive guide to starship weapons and armor. This ROM contains specification for weapons and armor developed by the Halo Races.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objSendMessage gSource Nil "\"Rowena's Weapons and Armor (Volume IV)\" installed") (itmEnumTypes "adsw" itemType (if (and (geq (itmGetLevel itemType) 16) (leq (itmGetLevel itemType) 20)) (itmSetReference itemType) ) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

ItemType.name: [ROM(s) of ]Rowena's Weapons and Armor: Volume V
ItemType.description: The definitive guide to starship weapons and armor. This ROM contains specification for weapons and armor used by the Hierodules and the entities Oracus and Domina.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objSendMessage gSource Nil "\"Rowena's Weapons and Armor (Volume V)\" installed") (itmEnumTypes "adsw" itemType (if (and (geq (itmGetLevel itemType) 21) (leq (itmGetLevel itemType) 25)) (itmSetReference itemType) ) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

ItemType.name: autopilot ROM
ItemType.description: This program allows the ship's captain to rest while the ship maintains a steady course.

Language.Text: Autopilot installed
Ship already has an autopilot
Installed redundant autopilot
Autopilot repaired

ItemType.name: vial(s) of thioseptal
ItemType.description: Sodium thioseptal is a drug used to induce a temporary coma.

Language.Text: dose(s)

ItemType.name: Korolov shipping container
ItemType.description: These standardized shipping containers hold everything from ore to consumer goods.

ItemType.name: Luminous 5care algorithm
ItemType.description: This cube contains algorithms used by Luminous to control its drones. When invoked on a quantum CPU, this causes drones to immediately leave the system.
ItemType.Invoke:
(switch ; If we don't have a quantum CPU (not (progHasQuantumCPU gSource)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Quantum CPU required")
; Otherwise, we scare any Luminous drones (block (targets) (setq targets (sysFindObject gSource "sEN:20; B:luminousDrone;")) (enum targets target (block Nil (shpCancelOrders target) (shpOrderGate target) ) ) (if targets (objSendMessage gSource Nil "5care: Program complete") (objSendMessage gSource Nil "5care: No carrier signal") )
(itmSetKnown gItem) (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) ) )

ItemType.name: Luminous 7ame algorithm
ItemType.description: When invoked, this algorithm will reprogram a Luminous drone and imprint it with instructions to defend its programmer.
ItemType.Invoke:
(switch ; If we don't have a quantum CPU (not (progHasQuantumCPU gSource)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Quantum CPU required")
; Otherwise, we choose a random Luminous drone (block (target) (setq target (random (sysFindObject gSource "sEN:20; B:luminousDrone;")))
(if (not target) (objSendMessage gSource Nil "7ame: No carrier signal") (block Nil (objSetSovereign target &svFriendlyLuminous;) (shpSetController target "auton") (shpOrderEscort target gSource) (objSendMessage gSource target "7ame: Program complete") ) )
(itmSetKnown gItem) (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) ) )

ItemType.name: seismic scanner pod
ItemType.description: This scanner pod emits a seismic wave that reveals the location of valuable resources in asteroids. It has a range of 30 light-seconds.

Events.OnEffect: (sysCreateWeaponFire &vtSeismicScannerPower; (list (@ gData 'sourceObj) 'explosion Nil "seismic scanner pod" 0x00) (objGetPos (@ gData 'podObj)) 0 0 Nil (list 'detonateNow 'fireEffect 'soundEffect) )

ItemType.name: class A excavation pod
ItemType.description: Class A excavation pods uses a seismic charge to extract ore from asteroids in a 30 light-second radius. Excavation pods are most effective on metallic and volcanic asteroids.

Events.OnEffect: (sysCreateWeaponFire &vtClassAExcavationPower; (list (@ gData 'sourceObj) 'explosion Nil "class A excavation pod" 0x00) (objGetPos (@ gData 'podObj)) 0 0 Nil (list 'detonateNow 'fireEffect 'soundEffect) )

ItemType.name: class B excavation pod
ItemType.description: This improved excavation pod has a 40 light-second radius. Excavation pods are most effective on metallic and volcanic asteroids.

Events.OnEffect: (sysCreateWeaponFire &vtClassBExcavationPower; (list (@ gData 'sourceObj) 'explosion Nil "class B excavation pod" 0x00) (objGetPos (@ gData 'podObj)) 0 0 Nil (list 'detonateNow 'fireEffect 'soundEffect) )

ItemType.name: advanced scanner pod
ItemType.description: This is an improved version of the seismic scanner pod. It detects ore in a 60 light-second radius.

Events.OnEffect: (sysCreateWeaponFire &vtAdvancedScannerPower; (list (@ gData 'sourceObj) 'explosion Nil "advanced scanner pod" 0x00) (objGetPos (@ gData 'podObj)) 0 0 Nil (list 'detonateNow 'fireEffect 'soundEffect) )

ItemType.name: class C excavation pod
ItemType.description: The class C uses a thermonuclear change and has a range of 60 light-seconds. Excavation pods are most effective on metallic and volcanic asteroids.

Events.OnEffect: (sysCreateWeaponFire &vtClassCExcavationPower; (list (@ gData 'sourceObj) 'explosion Nil "class C excavation pod" 0x00) (objGetPos (@ gData 'podObj)) 0 0 Nil (list 'detonateNow 'fireEffect 'soundEffect) )

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]artificial plasma
ItemType.description: This artificial blood can be stored almost indefinitely and is compatible with all blood types.

ItemType.name: portable autodoc
ItemType.description: Autodocs are small, multi-limbed drones that treat simple wounds and dispense basic medicines. Though no replacement for a real medtech or even a good rejuv tank, autodocs are quite popular in remote stations.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Bombay Sapphire gin
ItemType.description: Bombay Sapphire has maintained enormous popularity as a premium spirit with ten botanicals and a unique vapor-infusion procession to make a subtly complex, highly nuanced gin.

ItemType.name: [kilo(s) of ]Booster
ItemType.description: A strong base of O3 'boosted' with a pure dose of metaendorphile paste, this drug is considered to be the best narcotic on the black market. It is extremely addictive, and thus banned everywhere.

ItemType.name: [vessel(s) of ]boson condensate
ItemType.description: This exotic state of matter can support extremely high energy densities. It is used in zero-point energy generators.

ItemType.name: [gram(s) of ]unlicensed cancer dust
ItemType.description: Cancer dust is a complex blend of oncokillers and nanomachines that cures most forms of human cancer. This is an unlicensed (and thus illegal) batch, most likely manufactured at a Death Drug laboratory.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]California Cabernet Sauvignon
ItemType.description: Even after the disastrous tectonic quakes of the 22nd century, the island city states of New California on Earth continue to make the most excellent of red wines.

ItemType.name: calligraphy scroll
ItemType.description: This is a beautiful parchment scroll containing archaic Chinese calligraphy.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]carbon dioxide scrubbers
ItemType.description: The technology for extracting carbon dioxide from breathable air has not changed in hundreds of years.

ItemType.name: CDM archive
ItemType.attributes: communion, consumable, humanTech, info, soul, notForSale
ItemType.description: This rare optical cube contains the memory patterns of a denizen of the Concatenated Digital Metropolis.

Language.Text:
You hear a voice in your head but can't understand the words. You feel joy and sadness, triumph and failure, surprise and regret.
Eventually, all those feelings fade and you're left with the comfortable presence of Domina.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]Centauri rice
ItemType.description: With its subtle flavor and rich aroma, Centauri rice is a popular accompaniment to many gourmet dishes.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]cerium electrodes
ItemType.description: Cerium electrodes have several industrial uses, including as catalysts for nanofactories.

ItemType.name: cerusite crystal
ItemType.description: These rare crystals are prized by Ringers for their beauty, but otherwise serve no purpose.

ItemType.name: [tank(s) of ]chronimium gas
ItemType.attributes: AntiMatter; Consumable; Explosive; humanTech, Res; Volatile
ItemType.description: Chronimium is a high-energy elemental gas. In pure form it can be used as a fuel for antimatter reactors.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]cyanavir
ItemType.description: Cyanavir is a powerful antiviral drug that is particularly effective against filoviruses and retroviruses.

ItemType.name: death cube
ItemType.attributes: communion, consumable, humanTech, info, soul, notForSale
ItemType.description: The thoughts and memories of a human being are encoded into this holographic cube. These mementos of the dead were popular last century.

Language.Text:
In your mind you see a house beneath the wide open skies of a planet—probably Earth. A woman waves through a window; she is happy for you, but her face is sad. You try to walk towards the house, but your legs won't move.
You look down and see that you're back in the sanctum. You feel the presence of Domina.

ItemType.name: digital wrist computer
ItemType.description: A few decades ago, digital wrist computers were quite fashionable, and some of the more expensive models were worn by celebrities. This utilitarian model was not one of them.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]erbium rods
ItemType.description: Forged into an exotic alloy, erbium rods are used in high-performance starship components.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]dried Europan ice moss
ItemType.description: This exquisite spice is made from a dried moss originally found on the frozen Jovian moon.
ItemType.sortName: Europan ice moss, kilo of dried

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Exile Starport Champagne
ItemType.description: Popularized by the 3DV epic, 'Exile Starport', this champagne is trendy and very expensive.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]fusion triggers
ItemType.description: Fusion triggers are nuclear implosion devices used in fusion weapons such as the XM900 Lucifer missile. Fusion triggers are illegal throughout Human Space.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]grade B grains
ItemType.description: This is a genetically modified grain variety that is designed to grow under low-gravity and high-radiation conditions. This grade is not approved for human consumption and is only used for animal feed.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]frozen natural ham
ItemType.description: A guilty pleasure of the executive crowd, natural ham has unique subtle flavors without any of the carcinogenic effects of the vat-grown variety.

ItemType.name: Humagen heart and lungs prosthesis| Humagen heart and lungs prostheses
ItemType.description: This ancient artificial heart and lungs prosthesis is seldom used anymore, but many people believe it to be superior to current medical technologies.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]heavy water
ItemType.description: Heavy water is used by many fusion reactors as a moderator.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Hennessy cognac
ItemType.description: Old and extremely rare, the years of maturing have left only that which is essential--the richness and smoothness of an exceptional, full-bodied cognac, incredibly long in the mouth.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]frozen Hogei salmon
ItemType.description: Clone farms of the Senpaku Hogei Corporation make this well-respected product at a reasonable (compared to Earth salmon) price.

ItemType.name: [roll(s) of ]holmium fiber
ItemType.description: This exotic rare-earth element is woven into fibers for use in ion-sensitive equipment.

ItemType.name: human organ
ItemType.description: Held in a vat of suspension fluid, this human organ is ready to be transplanted.

ItemType.name: human cadaver
ItemType.description: The traffic in human cadavers is common in the Outer Realm. Many people believe that Teratons use human cadavers for strange experiments.

Language.Text:
You sense the presence of Domina examining the cadaver. You imagine her hand reaching into the skull and kneading the brain like a lump of putty.
When you open your eyes, the cadaver is gone.

You sense the presence of Domina examining the cadavers. You imagine her hand reaching into each skull and kneading the brain like a lump of putty.
When you open your eyes, the cadavers are gone.

ItemType.name: [tank(s) of ]hydrogen gas
ItemType.description: Hydrogen is used for many industrial purposes. Handle with care to avoid explosions.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]hypermycin
ItemType.description: Hypermycin is the strongest civilian antibiotic—only a few strains of phobos aerium are immune to it.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]Icelandic salmon
ItemType.description: This crate contains whole salmon from the Earth oceans around Iceland. The salmon has been carefully cryopreserved and tastes as fresh as possible for fish caught dozens of light-years away.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Imperial caviar
ItemType.description: This precious delicacy is imported from Earth and served only at special corporate functions.

ItemType.name: precision ithalium watch(es)
ItemType.description: These beautifully handmade, mechanical wristwatches are often worn by high-level corporate officers.

ItemType.name: [chest(s) of ]jasmine pearl tea
ItemType.description: This green tea, scented with natural jasmine, is hand-rolled into pearl shapes.

ItemType.name: [chest(s) of ]jinn-khan
ItemType.description: Created by the Ringers, the khan plant is a genetically-engineered, cancer-fighting descendant of the lowly tea bush. The jinn-khan variety is one of the most popular in Human Space.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]Kobe spring water
ItemType.description: Famous for its refreshing effects and calming advertisements, Kobe spring water is the drink of choice for corporate executives.

ItemType.name: [disk(s) of ]lanthanum glass
ItemType.description: Lanthanum glass has special optical properties used in lasers, fields generators, and other starship components.

ItemType.name: laudanum ampule
ItemType.description: Laudanum is an illegal drug popular with the middle members of the Corporate Hierarchy.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]genuine leather boots
ItemType.description: Expensive almost to the point of extravagance, leather boots are nevertheless popular throughout the wealthier parts of the Commonwealth.

ItemType.name: malachite crystal
ItemType.description: These rare crystals are prized by Ringers for their beauty, but otherwise serve no purpose.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Martian nori
ItemType.description: This exotic seaweed grows only in the subterranean water havens of Mars. Martian nori is strongly hallucinogenic if consumed and is consequently banned throughout most of Human Space.

ItemType.name: Commonwealth Medal(s) of Distinction
ItemType.description: The Commonwealth Medal of Distinction is given to officers in the Commonwealth Militia who manage to survive for more than a few missions.

ItemType.name: Commonwealth Medal(s) of Honor
ItemType.description: The Commonwealth Medal of Honor is a square platinum plate micro-engraved with the names of those killed in the Syrtis bombing of Earth in 2243.

ItemType.name: Microsaur™| Microsaurs™
ItemType.description: This genetically engineered pet has long been the symbol of conspicuous consumption among the corporate elite.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]Misato sake
ItemType.description: The finest Earth sake is made in a small town in Japan.

ItemType.name: neodymium magnet array
ItemType.description: Neodymium permanent magnets are ubiquitous in various starship components and devices.

ItemType.name: neural processor
ItemType.description: Neural processors are key components in AI systems.

Language.Text: You feel the presence of Domina examining the %itemName%. She wrings out every last quantum bit of information.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]neuranase
ItemType.description: Neuranase is a non-addictive painkiller used both for acute and chronic pain.

ItemType.name: Neuros personal media player
ItemType.description: The Neuros personal media player is a portable device that feeds signals directly into the sensory branches of the brain.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]New Coke
ItemType.description: This vintage beverage is extremely popular with high-level corporate and military leaders.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Bariani olive oil
ItemType.description: One of the finest olive oils available in Human Space, Bariani olive oil is imported from Earth at great cost.

ItemType.name: optical knowledge array
ItemType.description: This quantum-optical system is used to store and process large amounts of information.

Language.Text: You feel the presence of Domina examining the %itemName%. She wrings out every last quantum bit of information.

ItemType.name: [tank(s) of ]liquid oxygen
ItemType.description: This is an insulated and pressurized tank of LOX. Handle with care to avoid explosions.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]natural periweed
ItemType.description: This subtle spice is grown only on some Centauri planets.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]cryofrozen prime beef
ItemType.description: Most people think vat-grown beef is good enough and far more affordable, but connoisseurs cannot get enough of this organically-grown prime beef.

ItemType.name: promethium crystal
ItemType.description: These beautiful and rare crystals of promethium-147, an exotic and powerful isotope, are used by the Ringers Collective as currency.

ItemType.name: [container(s) of ]quantum vacuum
ItemType.description: Exotic vacuums are the ground-state for zero-point energy generators. This container holds several terrawatt hours of vacuum3 and vacuum7.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]rejuv tank fluid
ItemType.description: Critically injured patients are healed in half the time if placed inside a rejuv tank.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Ringer ambrosia
ItemType.description: This exquisite nectar contains active ingredients that help Ringers to concentrate. Its effect on pure humans is less well understood.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Ringer spice
ItemType.description: Corporate chefs seek out this spice, grown only by the Ringers, which produces a flavor unlike anything from Earth.

ItemType.name: [bolt(s) of ]silk
ItemType.description: This rarest of fabrics has many synthetic imitators, but none approach the feel of organic silk.

ItemType.name: tailored silk suit
ItemType.description: This designer woman's suit is popular with corporate executives and Commonwealth officials.

ItemType.name: bootleg Star Wars 3DV
ItemType.description: The Ultimate Edition of this classic passive fiction is too expensive for most consumers, but an underground criminal organization has cracked the encryption keys and produced a bootleg version.

Language.Text: (typTranslate gType (cat "sisters.donateDesc." (mod (divide (unvGetTick) 18000) 5)))
"We prefer the version in which Han shoots first."
"These space operas should not distract you from your real mission."
"These works of fiction cannot help us."
"A tale about a quasi-religious order following a mysterious all-powerful force has no relevance to our mission."
"We thank you for your good intentions; may Domina be with you. Always."

ItemType.name: Tempus syrette
ItemType.description: Tempus is a popular amphetamine that slows down the user's subjective time. Tempus is illegal throughout most of Human Space.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Terran eggs
ItemType.description: Infinitely superior to the synthetic variety produced on most stations.

ItemType.name: :a uranium fuel rod
ItemType.attributes: consumable, fissionFuel, fuel, humanTech, notStandardFuel, res
ItemType.description: Refined uranium fuel rods are used in old industrial reactors, but they can be adapted to starship use.

ItemType.name: [nodule(s) of ]crystalline uranium
ItemType.description: The rarest form of uranium, these spherical nodules are prized by Ringers for their beauty.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]hydrocarbons
ItemType.description: Hydrocarbons are used by industrial autofacs to create plastics and other consumer items.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]white rice
ItemType.description: This is a high-protein variety of rice popular in the Commonwealth.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Stimuzine muscle-enhancers
ItemType.description: Stimuzine is a popular drug that stimulates muscle growth in low-gravity environments.

ItemType.name: [cask(s) of ]Venusian Hellas rum
ItemType.description: This popular rum is made throughout the Commonwealth at stations licensed by the Cloud9 Corporation.

ItemType.name: [container(s) of ]frozen supplies
ItemType.description: Much of the food available on stations is shipped frozen from various agricultural centers.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]frozen beef cylinders
ItemType.description: This vat-grown meat tastes remarkably like beef, at least according to anyone who has never been on Earth.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]Kennebec Salmonite
ItemType.description: This vat-grown synthetic meat tastes almost, but not quite, totally unlike salmon.

ItemType.name: [tank(s) of ]water ice
ItemType.description: Water is a valuable commodity in the depths of space.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]Charles River sparkling water
ItemType.description: Though this water is no longer bottled at its eponymous river, the brand is still considered a mark of purity throughout the Commonwealth.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]grade A grains
ItemType.description: Quadrotriticale, the most common grade A grain, is a genetically modified variety suitable for human consumption and generally ideal for space-borne colonies.

ItemType.name: [bolt(s) of ]neolinen
ItemType.description: A synthetic fabric superior to cotton and generally cheap to produce.

ItemType.name: [spool(s) of ]carbon fiber
ItemType.description: Carbon fibers are used in many industrial processes to create materials that are lightweight and heat-resistant.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Martian Merlot
ItemType.description: Grown in the arid hills of New Marineris, this wine is known for its strong flavor and traditional production methods.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]frozen synthetic chicken
ItemType.description: The United Earth Military developed this synthetic food to feed the millions of soldiers needed for the invasion of Mars.

ItemType.name: [keg(s) of ]Red Nebula beer
ItemType.description: Red Nebula beer is advertised throughout the Commonwealth.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]medical supplies
ItemType.description: This crate contains standard medical supplies such as antibiotics, sterilization paste, and plasma precursors.

ItemType.name: [barrel(s) of ]Eridani mineral water
ItemType.description: A product of Starton Eridani, this mineral water is trendy among the corporate crowd.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]biofactor paste
ItemType.description: Biofactor paste is a genetically engineered substance that promotes healing and delays aging.

ItemType.name: [bolt(s) of ]photocotton
ItemType.description: Photocotton is modified variety of cotton that can be dyed by simple exposure to light of different wavelengths.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Australian Chardonnay
ItemType.description: Chardonnay produced by the ancient methods of Australia is today considered to be the best in the Commonwealth.

ItemType.name: [case(s) of ]Europan Ice vodka
ItemType.description: Vodka has always been an important liquor in the frozen colonies of Europa. This is the best Europan brand and the only one exported outside of the Sol system.

ItemType.name: [crate(s) of ]frozen megathere meat
ItemType.description: Huge farms on Earth raise this once extinct animal to produce a delicacy known throughout the Commonwealth.

ItemType.name: [roll(s) of ]hyperfiber
ItemType.description: Hyperfiber is a nanoengineered molecular strand of carbon.

ItemType.name: neolinen business suit
ItemType.description: The standard uniform of the Corporate Hierarchy.

ItemType.name: Segway antigrav platform
ItemType.description: The Segway is not a true antigrav platform (it relies on noisy microfans). Nevertheless, it has proven to be useful in stations and other low-gravity environments.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]copper ore
ItemType.description: Copper is a vital component in most electrical systems, although exotic alloys have largely replaced it in specialised high-performance equipment.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]titanium ore
ItemType.description: Titanium ore is used commercially for space-rated structures and components.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]vanadium ore
ItemType.description: Vanadium is used heavily in specialised steels, as well as in the production of advanced batteries and catalyst packs.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]helium regolith
ItemType.description: Rocks containing helium³ are the main raw material for the fuel rods used by starships.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]plasteel ore
ItemType.description: Plasteel is a stronger and lighter alloy of titanium.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]uranium ore
ItemType.description: Uranium is the most common fissionable material. Uranium ore can be processed into nuclear fuel for low-tech industries.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]cobalt-thorium ore
ItemType.description: This exotic fissionable material is used as a catalyst in high-energy fusion reactors.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]niobium ore
ItemType.description: Niobium is used in the creation of superconducting magnets, medical implants, and exotic super-alloys.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]palladium ore
ItemType.description: Palladium is a critical element as a catalyst in various industrial processes.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]cerallox ore
ItemType.description: Cerallox ore is a crystalline blend of carbon and metals; it is the primary component of ceralloy, a heat-resistant alloy.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]gold ore
ItemType.description: Beyond the demand for jewelry, gold is used as a conductor in many electronic devices.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]xenotite ore
ItemType.description: Xenotite was one of the first minerals to be discovered in another star system. Xenotite can be refined to produce a fuel for antimatter reactors.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]cerium ore
ItemType.description: Cerium is one of the easiest of the rare-earth elements to extract from ore, and has a wide variety of industrial uses.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]duranium ore
ItemType.description: Duranium ore is a mixture of titanium, hexanium, and other exotic metals. Duranium is the primary component of Duralloy steel.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]platinum ore
ItemType.description: Platinum is a key component in many industrial processes.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]pteracnium ore
ItemType.description: Pteracnium is one of the only transuranic elements that is stable under normal conditions. When bombarded with high-energy particles, pteracnium releases a cascade of anti-protons that can sustain a starship engine.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]hexanium ore
ItemType.description: Hexanium is a cobalt-based superalloy found naturally in some asteroids. It is the raw material used to create Hexphase, a material used widely by the Commonwealth fleet.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]molybdenum ore
ItemType.description: Molybdenum is used to make high-grade lubricants, advanced alloys and critical industrial components.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]orthosteel ore
ItemType.description: Orthosteel is used for military armors.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]ithalium ore
ItemType.description: Ithalium is a rare and powerful alloy found mostly on volcanic worlds.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]iridium ore
ItemType.description: While iridium is a common constituent of many asteroids, only a small fraction is of a high enough grade to be worth the difficult job of extracting it.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]lonsdaleite ore
ItemType.description: Lonsdaleite is an unusual allotrope of carbon formed when asteroids containing graphite collide at high speed. It is a critical componant of many advanced composites.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]neutronium ore
ItemType.description: The densest substance known, a ton of neutronium could fit in the palm of your hand. The secret of its manufacture is known only to the ancient races.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]tantalum ore
ItemType.description: Tantalum capacitors form the backbone of many advanced technologies. The metal itself is used heavily for industrial equipment in caustic environments.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]hadron archaeolith
ItemType.description: This rare resource was originally created in the Big Bang and cannot be replenished. It is used today as a fuel for zero-point energy generators.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]tetramite ore
ItemType.description: Tetramite is a rare mineral used by Ringers and Teratons for many of their advanced industries.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]etherium ore
ItemType.description: Etherium is a rare ore with still mysterious properties. Etherium is eagerly sought by Ringers and Teratons.

ItemType.name: [ton(s) of ]hyperonic ore
ItemType.description: Hyperonic ore has a very high concentration of hyperons and consequently can be used in zero-point energy generators.

ItemType.name: ShieldOverdrive v1.0 algorithm cube
ItemType.attributes: commonwealth, defective, info, minorItem, quantumProgram, shieldDamage
ItemType.description: The first version of the ShieldOverdrive algorithm is promising but contains significant bugs.

Properties.Definition: True
Properties.DynamicGlobal:
; This cube only works 50% of the time.
(if (leq (random 1 100) 50) "+hpBonus:20" "-hpBonus:20" )
Properties.Definition: True
True

Language.Text: The cube runs a shield optimization program.
You can run %useItem% on %dstItem%, but we cannot guarantee success.
You can run %useItem% on %dstItem%, but we cannot guarantee success.

ItemType.name: ShieldOverdrive v3.1.8 algorithm cube
ItemType.description: This algorithm enhances shield generators of technology levels 4 through 9.

Properties.Definition: "+hpBonus:20"
True

Language.Text: The cube runs a shield optimization program.

ItemType.name: Scramble1.5 algorithm cube
ItemType.description: This algorithm hacks into near-by enemy ship computers and temporarily disable their control systems. Scramble1.5 requires a quantum CPU to execute.
ItemType.Invoke:
(switch ; If we don't have a quantum CPU (not (progHasQuantumCPU gSource)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Quantum CPU required")
; Otherwise, we paralyze enemy ships in the area (block (targets) (setq targets (sysFindObject gSource "sEN:16;")) (enum targets target (objProgramDamage target gSource "Scramble1.5" 6 (objMakeParalyzed target (random 600 1200)) ) ) (if targets (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Scramble1.5: Targets disabled") (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Scramble1.5: No targets in range") )
(itmSetKnown gItem) (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) ) )

ItemType.name: ShieldEfficiency v1.2.5 algorithm cube
ItemType.description: This algorithm increases the efficiency of shield generators of technology levels 4 through 9.

Properties.Definition: "+efficient:20"
True

Language.Text: The cube runs a shield optimization program.

ItemType.name: patient in a rejuv tank|patients in rejuv tanks
ItemType.description: This is a rejuvenation tank

Properties.DynamicData:
(block ( (deathOn (itm@ gItem 'deathOn)) (criticalOn (- deathOn 900)) (now (unvGetTick)) ) (switch (geq now deathOn) 'dead
(geq now criticalOn) 'critical
'stable ) )

Language.Text: You see a patient floating inside the rejuvenation tank. Bright displays on the front seem to show stable vital signs, but a red message keeps flashing: "Medical Attention Needed".
The patient inside the rejuvenation tank appears to be in distress. Vital signs are fluctuating, and a big red message keeps flashing: "Conditional Critical".
The patient in the rejuvenation tank is dead. All vital signs have ceased, and the displays are ominously dark.
Patient in rejuv tank has died.
Patient in critical condition.
Patient will die in %time% seconds.

ItemType.name: Sapiens radiation mine(s)
ItemType.description: This radioactive mine triggers when an enemy ship comes within range.

ItemType.name: silicarb field crystal
ItemType.description: Silicon-carbide crystals increase the energy density of shield generators. This crystal is compatible with generators up to tech level 5.

Language.Text: The energy field crystal is made of silicon-carbide, which boosts shield strength.

ItemType.name: shield enhancement ROM
ItemType.description: This ROM upgrades a shield generator so that it is more effective at absorbing damage. The ROM works on generators up to technology level 6.

Language.Text: The ROM improves a shield's energy density.
The ROM cannot enhance this %dstItem%.
Shield generator is too alien for the ROM to enhance.

ItemType.name: defective shield enhancement ROM
ItemType.description: This aftermarket ROM worked on older shield generators, but all current shield generators are ionized by it.

Language.Text: This is a defective shield enhancement ROM.
The ROM has no effect on your damaged %shield%.
The defective ROM reset your %shield%, restoring it to normal.
The %shield% has lost its previous enhancement.
Fortunately, the %shield% is too advanced to be affected.
Your %shield% has been ionized.

ItemType.name: Hiro's shield optimizer
ItemType.description: One of Hiro's first creations, this ROM can increase the strength of any shield generator up to tech level 6.

Language.Text: Hiro: No shield detected. ROM abort.
Hiro: Shield optimization complete.
Hiro: Shield already enhanced. ROM abort.
Hiro: Shield repair algorithm successful.
Hiro: Shield tech too high. ROM abort.
Hiro: Non-energy shield found. ROM abort.
Hiro: Shield is compatible. Ready to perform optimization.
Hiro: Shield already enhanced. ROM abort.
Hiro: Shield is compatible. Ready to perform optimization.

ItemType.name: rubidium field crystal
ItemType.description: Rubidium crystals create energy fields that resist particle and blast damage. This crystal is compatible with generators of tech levels 1-7.

Language.Text: The energy field crystal is made of silicon-carbide, which boosts shield strength.

ItemType.name: green etherium field crystal
ItemType.description: Green etherium is used to create energy fields that reflect particle beam energy. Unfortunately, it has a limited duration. This crystal works on tech levels 2-8.

Events.OnRemovedAsEnhancement: (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Green etherium crystal has burned out")

Language.Text: The crystal is made of green etherium, which reflects particle beam energy.

ItemType.name: diamond field crystal
ItemType.description: Diamond field crystals increase the power of shield generators. Unlike other field crystals, a generator can use multiple diamond field crystals. These crystals are compatible with shields of tech level 3-9.

Language.Text: This is a diamond superconductor, which increases the strength of shield generators.

ItemType.name: trillum field crystal
ItemType.description: Crystalline trillum increases the power efficiency of high-energy shields. These crystals are compatible with tech levels 3-9.

Language.Text: This is a trillum energy field crystal, which increases the energy efficiency of shield generators.

ItemType.name: decayed etherium field crystal
ItemType.description: In pristine state, this field crystal is used to reflect ion energy. But this decayed crystal would do more harm than good.

Language.Text: The crystal is decayed etherium, which degrades a shield's resistance to ion damage.
Fortunately, the %dstItem% is too advanced to be affected.
Fortunately, the %dstItem% is too primitive to be affected.

ItemType.name: molbidium field crystal
ItemType.description: Molbidium crystals are often used to increase the power density of shield generators. They are compatible with shields of tech levels 4-10.

Language.Text: The crystal is made of molbidium, which increases shield strength.

ItemType.name: superlattice field crystal
ItemType.description: This crystalline superlattice absorbs high-energy particles and thus resist ion and thermonuclear damage. This crystal is compatible with shield generators of tech levels 4-10.

Language.Text: The energy field crystal is made of a metamaterial superlattice, which absorbs ion and thermonuclear damage.

ItemType.name: blue etherium field crystal
ItemType.description: Blue etherium is used to create energy fields that reflect ion energy. Unfortunately, it has a limited duration. These crystals work on shields of tech level 5-11.

Events.OnRemovedAsEnhancement: (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Blue etherium crystal has burned out")

Language.Text: The crystal is made of blue etherium, which reflects ion energy.

ItemType.name: yellow etherium field crystal
ItemType.description: Yellow etherium is used to create energy fields that reflect positron energy. Unfortunately, it has a limited duration. This crystal works on tech levels 7-13.

Events.OnRemovedAsEnhancement: (objSendMessage gSource Nil "Yellow etherium crystal has burned out")

Language.Text: The crystal is made of yellow etherium, which reflects positron energy.

ItemType.name: carved prayer stone
ItemType.description: A beautiful prayer stone cut out of a crystal of some sort; the symbol of Domina is carved on one face.

ItemType.name: jewel(s) of contemplation
ItemType.description: A heavy, pure crystal set in a platinum band; the symbol of Domina is inscribed on one face.

ItemType.name: hierolith crystal
ItemType.attributes: art, communion, consumable, lux, psionic, ringerValuable
ItemType.description: These hyperdense crystals are formed inside black holes; they resonate with transcendent consciousness.

ItemType.name: AutoSentinel®| AutoSentinels®
ItemType.description: For around 500 credits, OmniDefense Systems' AutoSentinel keeps you and your loved ones safe from harm. NOTE: For professional security needs, order the 1M battle auton.

ItemType.name: 300D defender auton
ItemType.description: This is a commercial auton primarily used for defending small stations. NOTE: For professional security needs, order the 1M battle auton.

ItemType.name: 310A aegis auton
ItemType.description: This variant of the 300D is equipped with an anti-missile defense system.

ItemType.name: 330M mule auton
ItemType.attributes: auton, cargoAuton, commonwealth, minorItem, omniDefense, utilityAuton
ItemType.description: Dock with this auton to store supplies on its cargo platform. This auton has space for 75 tons of cargo.

ItemType.name: defective auton
ItemType.attributes: auton, combatAuton, commonwealth, defective, minorItem, omniDefense
ItemType.description: The 200A series was recalled several years ago because of an unstable AI.

ItemType.name: 1M battle auton
ItemType.description: The 1M battle auton is the most powerful autonomous defense bot manufactured by the OmniDefense Systems corporation.

ItemType.name: TX3 explorer auton
ItemType.attributes: auton, explorerAuton, commonwealth, minorItem, taikon, utilityAuton
ItemType.description: Developed at the Taikon School of Exploration, this experimental auton can explore an entire star system.

ItemType.name: 1M/i battle auton
ItemType.description: This is a variant of OmniDefense Systems' 1M battle auton. Instead of a particle beam, it is equipped with an EMP cannon.

ItemType.name: helium³ fuel rod
ItemType.description: This standard He³ fuel rod fits most starship reactors.

ItemType.name: helium³ reactor assembly| helium³ reactor assemblies
ItemType.description: This is an enriched bundle of He³ fuel rods. Though more efficient than individual fuel rods, only reactors 50 megawatts and larger can accommodate them.

ItemType.name: xenotite fuel rod
ItemType.description: Starship reactors larger than 100MW need a denser fuel than helium. Highly-enriched xenotite, an exotic antimatter mineral, is a common alternative.

ItemType.name: pteracnium fuel rod
ItemType.description: Pteracnium is a stable transuranic compound of immense energy density. Refined and packaged as fuel rods this compound is ideal for gigawatt-class reactors.

ItemType.name: hadron-vacuum fuel cell

ItemType.name: superconducting coil
ItemType.description: This is a special type of coil used to repair superconducting shield generators.
ItemType.Invoke:
(switch ; Does the ship have a superconducting shield? If not ; then we can't do anything. (not (eq (shpGetShieldItemUNID gSource) &itSuperconductingShields;)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgSSRequired))
; Are the shields fully charged? If they are, then this ; won't do anything. (eq (shpGetShieldDamage gSource) 0) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgSSFull))
; Charge the shields (block Nil (shpRechargeShield gSource (random 40 60)) (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgSSRecharged)) ) )

Language.Text: Superconducting shields required
Superconducting shields already fully charged
Superconducting shields recharged

ItemType.name: slave coffin

Language.Text:
Seeing your concern, the abbess explains:
"Don't worry, they are unharmed. Domina will free their minds and give them a normal life."
You feel your connection to Domina strengthening, but when the lasers stop you see that the coffin is gone.

ItemType.name: contraband box(es)
ItemType.description: This sealed container, made out of an old ammunition box, contains illegal items.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block (cost count illegalItems) (setq illegalItems (itmCreateRandom "* +Illegal; -ContrabandBox; -SmugglersHold; -ID;" "ruccc ccur-"))
(setq cost (itmGetPrice illegalItems 'credit)) (setq cost (if (eq cost 0) 100 cost)) (setq count (divide (random 2000 4000) cost)) (setq count (if (ls count 1) 1 count)) (setq illegalItems (itmCreate (itmGetType illegalItems) count))
(intAmmoBoxOpen illegalItems) )

ItemType.name: contaminated ammunition box(es)
ItemType.attributes: ammoBox, commonwealth, consumable, cannotOrder, defective, notForSale
ItemType.description: This ammunition box contains leaky radioactive ordnance.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block (result)
; Do it
(setq result (objApplyCondition gSource 'radioactive { applyTo:'interior }))
; Report result
(objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType (cat 'msgResult. (@ result 'resultCode)) ) )
; Identify the box
(itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove box
(objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

Language.Text: The box contained leaky radioactive ordnance
The box contained leaky radioactive ordnance; your ship is unaffected
The box contained more radioactive waste

ItemType.name: booby-trapped ammunition box(es)

ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (objMakeParalyzed gSource (random 450 900)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate gType 'msgResult))
; Identify the box (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove box (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

Language.Text: The box explodes; ship disabled by EMP!

; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

Language.Text: ROM failure: Visual display temporarily blinded

ItemType.name: system map ROM
ItemType.description: This program accesses the central cartography libraries to generate a map of the current system.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block (mappedAll mapEnemy) (setq mappedAll True)
; Compute the probability of mapping an enemy station (switch (geq (sysGetLevel) 7) (setq mapEnemy 0)
(geq (sysGetLevel) 3) (setq mapEnemy (subtract 360 (multiply 72 (subtract (sysGetLevel) 2))))
(setq mapEnemy 360) )
; Iterate over all ships and stations in the system we might want to reveal (enum (sysFindObject gSource "Ts +property:hasDockingPorts; -property:known;") obj (switch (and (objMatches obj Nil "T -property:showMapLabel;") (not (objMatches obj gSource "*F +majorStation;")) ) Nil
(and (objIsEnemy gSource obj) (geq (objGetDestiny obj) mapEnemy) ) (setq mappedAll Nil)
(objHasAttribute obj "uncharted") (setq mappedAll Nil)
(block Nil (objSetKnown obj) (enum (objGetProperty obj 'subordinates) sub (if (objMatches sub Nil 'T) (objSetKnown sub)) ) ) ) )
(if mappedAll (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate &itSystemMapROM; 'mappedAll)) (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate &itSystemMapROM; 'mappedCharted)) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem)
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) )

Language.Text: Mapped all stations in system
Mapped charted stations in system

ItemType.name: military map ROM
ItemType.description: This program accesses military databases to generate a map of enemy stations in the system.
ItemType.Invoke:
(block Nil (if (not (sysFindObject gSource "TsA +commonwealth; +property:hasDockingPorts;"))
; If there are no commonwealth stations in the system, then we cannot function (objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate &itMilitaryMapROM; 'unableToConnect))
; Otherwise, we map all enemy stations (block Nil (enum (sysFindObject gSource "ETs") obj (objSetKnown obj) )
(objSendMessage gSource Nil (typTranslate &itMilitaryMapROM; 'mappedEnemies))
; Remove ROM (objRemoveItem gSource gItem 1) ) )
; Identify the item (itmSetKnown gItem) )

Language.Text: Unable to connect to military cartography in this system
Mapped all enemy stations in system
